channel.title: Comments on: Book Release: Learn Functional Programming with Elixir
channel.description: Plataformatec's place to talk about Ruby, Ruby on Rails, Elixir, and software engineering

item.title: By: Ulisses Almeida
item.dc:creator: Ulisses Almeida
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2017/08/book-release-learn-functional-programming-with-elixir/comment-page-1/#comment-1752">Another Anonymous</a>.
If you are a programmer beginner, I would recommend Learn Functional Programming With Elixir. If you are expert programmer, I think Programming Elixir by Dave Thomas Or Elixir in Action by Saša Jurić will suit better for your needs.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Another Anonymous.

If you are a programmer beginner, I would recommend Learn Functional Programming With Elixir.
If you are expert programmer, I think Programming Elixir by Dave Thomas Or Elixir in Action by Saša Jurić will suit better for your needs.

item.title: By: Ulisses Almeida
item.dc:creator: Ulisses Almeida
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2017/08/book-release-learn-functional-programming-with-elixir/comment-page-1/#comment-1751">Adolfo Neto (UTFPR)</a>.
Thanks! o/

item.title: By: Another Anonymous
item.dc:creator: Another Anonymous
item.description: This must be great book, I, currently employed as Java developer, ask if you can recommend this book as a guide for people like me who'd like to dive into functional programming? Or if more specific, I'd like to know if this book contains practices, tips, tricks of solving problems which would be easily solved in OOP paradigm but not in functional? Or can you recommend one?
item.content:encoded:
This must be great book, I, currently employed as Java developer, ask if
you can recommend this book as a guide for people like me who’d like to dive
into functional programming? Or if more specific, I’d like to know if
this book contains practices, tips, tricks of solving problems which
would be easily solved in OOP paradigm but not in functional? Or can you
recommend one?
